annotation.TEXT: Second spell. He fires out some amulets in random directions that split into many amulets. Depending on where he fires, it could be easy or hard to find openings.
The screen is going to go white here, so don't let it distract you as you finish off this group of enemies.

Also, another bullet randomly travels across the screen every so often, leaving a trail of stationary bullets in its wake. Then, horizontal lasers spawn from those bullets. Afterwards, those bullets start moving in random directions.
The purple bullets restrict your movement a little bit, but not too much. Otherwise, dodging is about the same, though I think this spell speeds up over time, so don't take too long in finishing it.
Whoa. Those were a little too close for comfort.
You should have over 4.00 power at this point. (I usually have between 4.30 and 4.40, depending on when the large power ups appeared.)
And we begin! Now this nonspell looks tricky at first, but it's got blind spots, and you can get fairly close and rack up some graze using one of those blind spots!

And here come the red bullets. This is where it gets really tricky, but you're close to the end at this point. The spell's timer runs out after you've dodged the 15th laser, so you only have to last through four more lasers after you've started dodging the red bullets.

At this point, little spell circles appear and fire small aimed bullet spreads at you. A quick sidestep can get you out of harm's way and graze them. (Note: The spell circles themselves are safe to touch.)

Wait, what?! How the heck was I supposed to dodge that? Well, there's what happens if you fail a "last spell". It ends right there, and acts as if you bombed, subtracting 1.00 power and adjusting "Point" accordingly.
This nonspell shouldn't be too tricky to dodge, except for the blurriness effect that's going on. Try not to let that screw with your mind.
This could potentially get tricky depending on where everything goes.
Ah, and here's our first midboss of the entire game, who looks like an angel. (I wonder why the normal stages didn't have midboss battles...)

And then, we get to repeat that whole FOE sequence again, but with fairies showing up at the same time now. You'll probably want to take out the fairies as soon as you can to reduce the threat of stray shots nailing you.
Each black ball only releases two waves of bullets, so if a black ball is coming your way, it's probably already exhausted its shots and you don't have to worry about being surprised.
The second nonspell is similar to the first, but aimed slightly differently, but it still comes with a set of blind spots!
Well, I was lucky enough to not have to move there! Now, this next nonspell is the same as the first. Hopefully all the blurriness won't drive you nuts.
"SG"? Anyway, this one's tricky. Don't worry too much about the tiny red bullets. I'd be more concerned with the white bullets coming at you from both sides and above.
For the sixth spell, get away from the edges of the screen. Maybe move about halfway between the screen edge and the boss.
And we go straight to the fifth spell. It's sort of similar to the previous one in a way, except the tiny bullets are fired in a different pattern.
Oh, and I'll be using the Youmu/Yuyuko-like team, Tetla Pot in this episode.
Now as for his third nonspell... The amulets are closer together this time, but... Yeah, blind spots. Hasn't this guy seen any of those "Icicle Fall -Easy-" YouTube videos?
And there's one last conversation, as usual.
"Synergy V"... Okay, first we'll start by sidestepping this laser, and...
Yeah, and the game is won! However, we've still got a "last spell" to do, which is a survival spell, and it's a doozy!
Okay, now for the fourth nonspell... Wait a minute... This is actually a spell card! Yes, the fourth spell starts right after the third one ends!
Then just do little dodges left or right as needed.
Try not to let these extra bullets throw you off too much, and make sure you can make it to the other side of each laser in time, or you're probably screwed.
"Opening of Magnificient Moe". There's a spelling error there, but whatever. It's kind of like his third spell, except the large balls are now aimed at you, so you've got to keep dodging!
Even if you do have to move, this spell usually isn't too difficult. Just be aware of the white shots that come out of the larger shots.
Sometimes I get unlucky and the shots get fired in such a way that my planned escape routes get blocked, or I get taken by surprise! (If only there was an easier way to deal with this spell...)
Right after those first 20 FOEs, there'll be a fairy on the right, 4 more FOEs, 2 more fairies in the middle, and then a whole row of 10 FOEs at once. Be ready for them.
Almost got it...
This is still not quite as insane as Mokou's 8th nonspell, though!
I tend to have good luck with "N"-shaped movements here, if you know what I mean.

Now, most of the other bullets on the screen won't matter, but after you've dodged three lasers, you'll start having to dodge through some white bullets as well, and after dodging eleven lasers, you'll have to start dodging red bullets too.
Eighth spell, and this one's tricky. He's got amulet spreads, and you've got to find a way through them!
After the first four firings, move to the center and then strafe sideways as this group fires at you. Should be simple enough.
Then, stay near the lower-left corner until a laser starts forming on your right, then move right through that before it fully forms, almost back to the "Enemy" marker. And just keep repeating that.
I could sit here grazing for the whole time limit, but that might get boring fast, so I'll just keep shooting him like normal while I'm grazing.

Whew! That was another spell that I sometimes get unlucky with. Oh? The second 1-up was granted at 40 million instead of 30 million here. Yeah, Extra stage is slightly different with that. Still, you can earn a few extra lives.

You'll often have to situate yourself between the horizontal lasers. Also, be careful: Very rarely, the randomly appearing bullet may spawn right below you and hit you without warning, so it may be a good idea to move away from the bottom of the screen a little bit.
Also, this spell gets faster over time, making things even more intense!

Now, just like IN's version of this team, if you're unfocused, you get a familiar that shoots the opposite direction from how you're moving. If you're focused, you get a spread shot (and even with no power, you still get a 3-way shot).
It's very easy to get pinned against the edge of the screen here. I tend to have more luck finding openings in time by going from one side of the screen to the other during each wave.
He's a... little white guy wearing a red cape and a Mettool helmet, and wielding a sword apparently.
Alright, and now for his final regular spell card!
Hello, and welcome back to another episode of Project Nize Festival! This time, we're going into the Extra stage!
After those two FOE columns from below, there'll be two FOE columns coming from above, but they're easier to quickly gun down.
Ooh, a multi-star-wipe to black...
Third spell. We've got random white bullets raining down, along with randomly aimed red balls that launch more bullets. There's a lot of stuff to pay attention to here.
After that row of FOEs will be another fairy, then FOEs will start emerging from the bottom. Move like I do to dodge them all and get some graze, and don't stop at all during this movement.
Hope you're good at dodging and that you don't get unlucky! (At least this doesn't seem as bad as Suwako's "Froggy Braves the Elements"!)
Don't relax yet. Go to either side to take out one pair of fairies and then sweep away the FOEs and the other two fairies. It might be tricky, so don't feel too bad about using up one bomb here.
Whoa! I got lucky there!
Also, I really like this guy's theme. I'm wondering... Is this music in any way derived from an official Touhou tune? Or is it totally original?
Right after the midboss, you'll be greeted by a huge group of FOEs with a fairy on the left leading them. Take out the fairy first, then slowly move right and sweep away the FOEs.

"sky flyer"... Okay, now this spell is a great source of graze. Sit just below the circling blue shots, moving only if a larger shot comes your way. Depending on the RNG, you may not have to move much or at all!
Oh, and just like with bosses in the normal game, there's a "last spell" here too! Just don't die at all by this point, have at least 1.00 power, and meet the point quota.
At last, we've reached the Extra stage boss!
Fifth nonspell. Just like the fourth, but a bit more intense. This is his toughest nonspell, and I sometimes ending up bombing here.
Woo, just made it there. Now one laser left!
"sky flyer -a strange visitor-"... You can get some decent graze on this spell too, but it's a much trickier spell.
One last group of five fairies will then attack. Take them out and grab their (possibly needed, depending on how things went earlier) power items.

Right at the start, ten FOEs will appear on the left, followed by ten on the right. They'll try to launch aimed shots at you, but they may not get off their shots if you kill them quickly enough. Just watch out for (and maybe graze) any bullets that do appear.
The black balls fire a few slow bullets around them, and faster bullets behind them as they move, so the ones that move up might be more dangerous for that reason.

Also, he's got a lot of HP on this one, so even though you get 60 seconds, it's entirely possible to time this out if you don't hit him enough. (That's happened to me before with the Marisa/Alice-like team.)
This one's not too difficult. The large black balls release lines of tiny bullets from them. Good for graze if you're careful.
"sky flyer -fisherman's horizon"... This one is rather interesting. First of all, the boss periodically launches shotgun-style spreads, which are aimed roughly towards you.
This one is more of the same, except now he's moving around, which eliminates the blind spots (finally) and makes dodging tougher.

Oh, and with this team, if you want your unfocused familiar to fire straight up right away, just tap shift to focus for an instant. Then, when you unfocus, it'll default to firing straight up until you move again. I like to do this often.

So, you've got stuff flying everywhere, but I'm just going to simplify it as best as I can with my strategy. Start at the bottom center (near the "Enemy" marker), then when a laser starts to form on your left, move through it before it fully forms.
You have to pay attention to the moving white bullet bands, as well as watch out for the randomly aimed cyan shots that shoot off a downward spread when they hit the outer circle.
And now, the fourth nonspell finally appears. I don't think any official Touhou bosses quite have a nonspell/spell pattern like this guy does.
Yeah, captured it! That one is not easy, even with that strategy! (Also, I earned my third 1-up at 160 million points, but that doesn't matter now.)
Seventh spell, "SY". It's kind of like the first spell, "SG", except a bit trickier, maybe.
This blurriness seems reminiscent of how stage 3 of Touhou 7 begins.

And, then it's right back to the title screen (oops, I hit Z an extra time there). But, what about the last team? And how do you capture the Extra midboss's "last spell"? Find out next time! To be continued...
